title: Experimental realization of entanglement between two Brownian particles
abstract:
We experimentally investigate the statistical properties of the quantum
analog of entanglement between two electric circuits equivalent to two Brownian
particles connected by an elastic force and maintained at different
temperatures through separate heat reservoirs. Uncertainty relations between
coordinates and coarse-grained velocity can produce a phenomenon similar to
quantum entanglement, where temperature plays the role of Planck's constant.
The theoretical analysis matches the experimental results, confirming that the
interconnected particles exhibit Brownian quantum-inspired classical
correlation entanglement. This effect arises from a coarse grained description
of Brownian motion and vanishes at a finer resolution. {The coarsening scales
range is measured too.
